Name: Home Assistance
Coverage__c: It covers your home against those nasty surprises that no one ever wants to deal with. Some of these issues include: boiler breakdown, blocked drains, burst pipes, drainage problems, electrical failure, roof damage.
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: HomeAssist    Definition: Home assistance cover is an add-on for your home insurance for sudden or urgent issues that affect your home. It can provide temporary repairs to stop an emergency when the worst happens.    Coverage: It covers your home against those nasty surprises that no one ever wants to deal with. Some of these issues include: boiler breakdown, blocked drains, burst pipes, drainage problems, electrical failure, roof damage.    Exclusion: Home assistance cover will cover sudden and unexpected issues which can cause damage to your home, make it unsafe or impossible to live in or could cause a risk to health and safety. You?ll be provided with a temporary repair (or if possible at the same time and cost, permanent) to stop the immediate emergency. This will make your home fit for living in again, until you arrange a permanent repair. It does not, however, cover non-emergencies, such as general maintenance, wear and tear, leaking taps, broken sockets or domestic appliances, power or other mains supply cuts doe to external factors
Exclusions__c: Home assistance cover will cover sudden and unexpected issues which can cause damage to your home, make it unsafe or impossible to live in or could cause a risk to health and safety. You’ll be provided with a temporary repair (or if possible at the same time and cost, permanent) to stop the immediate emergency. This will make your home fit for living in again, until you arrange a permanent repair. It does not, however, cover non-emergencies, such as general maintenance, wear and tear, leaking taps, broken sockets or domestic appliances, power or other mains supply cuts doe to external factors
Definition__c: Home assistance cover is an add-on for your home insurance for sudden or urgent issues that affect your home. It can provide temporary repairs to stop an emergency when the worst happens.

Name: Accidental Damage
Coverage__c: Some examples of what accidental damage covers you for includes: Breakage of fixed glass, doors, greenhouses, or conservatories; Damage to ceramic hobs and ceramic tops of fixed cookers; Accidents involving fixed sanitary ware and bathroom fittings; Damage done to drains, pipes and cables; Breakages to your walls and ceilings
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: HomeAddOnPremier    Definition:  This covers damage caused to your home’s permanent fixtures and fittings. From a wayward football smashing through your window to a mounted TV pulling down your wall, accidental damage has you covered.  Coverage: Some examples of what accidental damage covers you for includes: Breakage of fixed glass, doors, greenhouses, or conservatories; Damage to ceramic hobs and ceramic tops of fixed cookers; Accidents involving fixed sanitary ware and bathroom fittings; Damage done to drains, pipes and cables; Breakages to your walls and ceilings  Exclusions: Even with accidental damage cover, there’s still a few things you won’t be covered for. This includes accidental damage to gates, hedges and fences or any damage caused by vermin. Similarly, you won’t be covered against wear and tear.
Exclusions__c: Even with accidental damage cover, there’s still a few things you won’t be covered for. This includes accidental damage to gates, hedges and fences or any damage caused by vermin. Similarly, you won’t be covered against wear and tear.
Definition__c: This covers damage caused to your home’s permanent fixtures and fittings. From a wayward football smashing through your window to a mounted TV pulling down your wall, accidental damage has you covered.

Name: Residential Landlord Insurance 12345 67 89U 7101 7
Coverage__c: The policy covers the building, with the option of insuring any contents that belong to the landlord that are inside. Landlords' insurance is often referred to as buy-to-let insurance, however buy-to-let insurance is a type of landlords' insurance.
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: LandlordPremier    Definition: Landlords' insurance is an insurance policy that covers a property owner from financial losses connected with rental properties. It?ll provide theft, fire and weather damage cover for the structure of the rental property and any contents owned by the landlord that are within.    Coverage: The policy covers the building, with the option of insuring any contents that belong to the landlord that are inside. Landlords' insurance is often referred to as buy-to-let insurance, however buy-to-let insurance is a type of landlords' insurance.    Exclusion: Claims due to poor maintenance of the property are not covered
Exclusions__c: Claims due to poor maintenance of the property are not covered
Definition__c: Landlords' insurance is an insurance policy that covers a property owner from financial losses connected with rental properties. It’ll provide theft, fire and weather damage cover for the structure of the rental property and any contents owned by the landlord that are within.

Name: Public Liability Insurance
Coverage__c: Public liability insurance will cover the cost of any legal fees, the cost of compensation claims and the cost of repairing or replacing damaged property.
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: PubPlus    Definition: It protects you if someone makes a claim against you because they were accidentally injured, or their property was damaged.    Coverage: Public liability insurance will cover the cost of any legal fees, the cost of compensation claims and the cost of repairing or replacing damaged property.    Exclusion: If you?re injured as part of your business activities or as a result of someone else, you are not covered under your public liability policy.
Exclusions__c: If you’re injured as part of your business activities or as a result of someone else, you are not covered under your public liability policy.
Definition__c: It protects you if someone makes a claim against you because they were accidentally injured, or their property was damaged.

Name: Employer's Liability Insurance
Coverage__c: It covers the damages, compensation costs and legal fees that a current or ex-employee is entitled to as a result of illness or injury which may have been caused while working for your business. Employer’s liability insurance covers full-time and part-time employees, any self-employed contractors you hire, temporary staff, apprentices, volunteers, and people taking part in work experience or training schemes.
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: EmployerCov    Definition: Employers' liability insurance is a legal requirement under the Employers? Liability Act 1969. It?s there to protect your employees if they get injured or become ill as a result of working for your business.    Coverage: It covers the damages, compensation costs and legal fees that a current or ex-employee is entitled to as a result of illness or injury which may have been caused while working for your business. Employer?s liability insurance covers full-time and part-time employees, any self-employed contractors you hire, temporary staff, apprentices, volunteers, and people taking part in work experience or training schemes.    Exclusion: None
Definition__c: Employers' liability insurance is a legal requirement under the Employers’ Liability Act 1969. It’s there to protect your employees if they get injured or become ill as a result of working for your business.

Name: Personal Health Plan
Coverage__c: It covers planned consultations, treatments and operations
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: PrimeCare    Definition: This private health care policy provides comprehensive coverage for planned consultations, treatments, and operations. A planned consultation is defined as a scheduled visit with a healthcare professional for the purpose of diagnosis, assessment, or ongoing management of a medical condition. Treatments refer to medical interventions aimed at managing or curing a condition, including but not limited to therapies, medications, and other procedures prescribed by a licensed healthcare provider. Operations encompass any surgical procedures or interventions performed to treat or correct medical issues as planned and approved in advance by the policyholder's healthcare team.    Coverage: Under this policy, expenses related to planned consultations, treatments, and operations are covered up to the limits specified in the policy schedule. This includes fees for specialist consultations, diagnostic tests, and pre-operative assessments required before a planned procedure. The policy also covers costs associated with hospital stays, surgical procedures, and post-operative care as prescribed by the attending physician. Coverage extends to both inpatient and outpatient settings as necessary, ensuring that all medically necessary and pre-approved interventions are included.    Exclusions: This policy does not cover expenses related to emergency consultations, treatments, or operations that are not pre-scheduled or planned in advance. Additionally, coverage is excluded for any treatments or procedures deemed experimental or not supported by established medical guidelines. Costs associated with cosmetic procedures, elective surgeries not deemed medically necessary, and treatments for pre-existing conditions not declared at the time of policy purchase are also excluded. The policy further excludes expenses incurred due to non-compliance with medical advice or treatments sought outside the network of approved healthcare providers.

Name: Family Health Plan
Coverage__c: It covers planned consultations, treatments and operations for families
Full_Policy_Detail__c: Policy Name: FamilyCare    Definition: The FamilyCare Comprehensive Health Plan provides extensive coverage for all family members, encompassing planned consultations, treatments, and operations. A planned consultation refers to a pre-scheduled visit with a healthcare professional for diagnostic, evaluative, or management purposes. Treatments include any medical interventions aimed at addressing health conditions, such as therapies, medications, and other prescribed procedures. Operations are defined as any surgical procedures or interventions carried out with prior planning and approval by a licensed healthcare provider, aimed at treating or correcting medical issues for the policyholders.    Coverage: This policy offers full coverage for planned consultations, treatments, and operations for all enrolled family members, up to the limits detailed in the policy schedule. This includes consultations with specialists, necessary diagnostic tests, and pre-operative evaluations. Coverage also extends to hospital stays, surgical procedures, and post-operative care for both inpatient and outpatient services as required by the healthcare provider. The FamilyCare Comprehensive Health Plan ensures that all pre-approved and medically necessary interventions are included for the well-being of each family member.    Exclusions: The policy does not cover expenses related to emergency consultations, treatments, or operations that are not pre-planned. Additionally, it excludes costs associated with experimental treatments or procedures not supported by recognized medical guidelines. Cosmetic surgeries, elective procedures not deemed medically necessary, and treatments for pre-existing conditions not disclosed at the time of policy enrollment are also excluded. Furthermore, expenses incurred due to non-adherence to medical advice or treatments obtained outside of the network of approved healthcare providers are not covered.

Definition__c: Our mental health support provides ongoing, around-the-clock support for a wealth of mental health conditions, such as anxiety, depression and addiction.

Exclusions__c: Dental insurance won’t usually cover you for treatment which has been identified as necessary by a dentist before you joined.
